intro: Delissea parva, commonly known as the small delissea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Delissea parva is relatively rare and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
